Text: Wife of Julius Nepos:  His wife's given name is not in any primary source, all of which report her as the "neptis" of Leo I the Thracian of the Roman Empire in the East (457–74), and his spouse Verina.
Triplets:<His wife
3:
--------------------
Text: Wife of Julius Nepos:  The word "neptis" could translate as granddaughter, niece or (close) relative, but it is usually assumed that Julius' wife was Leo's niece, and more likely related by blood to Verina rather than Leo.
Triplets:<Wife of Julius Nepos
